bill_title: increase certain vehicle dealer license fees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase certain vehicle dealer license fees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-6B-13 be amended to read as follows: 32-6B-13. Upon making initial application for a dealer's license, the applicant shall pay a fee to the department. The initial fee required for each type of dealer's license is as follows: (1) Vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 ; (2) Used vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 ; (3) Motorcycle dealer's license-- $200 $250 ; (4) Trailer dealer's license-- $75 $125 ; or (5) Emergency vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 . All money collected pursuant to this section shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund. Section 2. That § 32-6B-15 be amended to read as follows: 32-6B-15. A renewal application shall be submitted to the department annually, prior to the expiration of the old license. The applicant shall pay a fee based on the following schedule to the department: (1) Vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $250 ; (2) Used vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $250 ; (3) Motorcycle dealer's license-- $75 $200 ; (4) Trailer dealer's license-- $50 $75 ; or (5) Emergency vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $250 . The renewal application shall contain the same information as required for the initial application in § 32-6B-6. Any application for renewal made after the expiration date shall be accompanied by a fee in the amount of the initial license fee as established in § 32-6B-13. Section 3. That § 32-7A-7 be amended to read as follows: 32-7A-7. The license fee for a dealer or manufacturer of mobile homes or manufactured homes is two hundred fifty three hundred dollars and the annual license renewal fee is seventy-five two hundred fifty dollars. An applicant shall pay the license fees to the county treasurer at the time an application for license is made. The license is for the full calendar a year, unless it is revoked for cause. The license shall expire at the end of the calendar year. Section 4. That § 32-7B-8 be amended to read as follows: 32-7B-8. Each license may be issued for a multiple year period. The application for license and all applicable fees are due prior to the issuance of the initial license. The initial fee for a license shall be two hundred fifty dollars , and a renewal license shall be one two hundred dollars. All licenses shall be reviewed annually by the department. The department shall mail to the licensee at the last known address a renewal notice. The department shall establish by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 the review date, if other than October first to December thirty-first, inclusive. If the licensee fails to return the renewal notice or to pay the applicable fees, the department shall cancel and revoke the license pursuant to the provisions of §§ 32-7B-16 and 32-7B-17. Section 5. That § 32-6C-5 be amended to read as follows: 32-6C-5. Upon making initial application for a dealer's license, the applicant shall pay a fee of one hundred fifty dollars to the department. Each license shall be valid from July first through the following June thirtieth, unless suspended or revoked prior to the expiration date. A renewal application shall be submitted to the department annually, along with a renewal fee of fifty one hundred dollars, prior to the expiration of the old license. Any snowmobile dealer that was licensed by the department during the period of July 1, 1985, through the following June 30, 1986, shall be eligible to renew his license for a fee of fifty dollars during the period of July 1, 1987, through June 30, 1988. The renewal application shall contain the same information as is required in § 32-6C-3. Any application for renewal made after the expiration date shall be accompanied by a one hundred dollars an initial license fee. Any licensee who does not file his application and renewal fee with the department prior to the expiration date shall cease to engage in business as a dealer on the license expiration date. All money collected pursuant to this section shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to increase certain vehicle dealer license fees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-6B-13 be amended to read as follows: 32-6B-13. Upon making initial application for a dealer's license, the applicant shall pay a fee to the department. The initial fee required for each type of dealer's license is as follows: (1) Vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 ; (2) Used vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 ; (3) Motorcycle dealer's license-- $200 $250 ; (4) Trailer dealer's license-- $75 $125 ; or (5) Emergency vehicle dealer's license-- $250 $300 . All money collected pursuant to this section shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund. Section 2. That § 32-6B-15 be amended to read as follows: 32-6B-15. A renewal application shall be submitted to the department annually, prior to the expiration of the old license. The applicant shall pay a fee based on the following schedule to the department: (1) Vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $175 ; (2) Used vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $175 ; (3) Motorcycle dealer's license-- $75 $150 ; (4) Trailer dealer's license-- $50 $100 ; or (5) Emergency vehicle dealer's license-- $100 $175 . The renewal application shall contain the same information as required for the initial application in § 32-6B-6. Any application for renewal made after the expiration date shall be accompanied by a fee in the amount of the initial license fee as established in § 32-6B-13. Section 3. That § 32-7A-7 be amended to read as follows: 32-7A-7. The license fee for a dealer or manufacturer of mobile homes or manufactured homes is two hundred fifty three hundred dollars and the annual license renewal fee is seventy-five one hundred fifty dollars. An applicant shall pay the license fees to the county treasurer at the time an application for license is made. The license is for the full calendar a year, unless it is revoked for cause. The license shall expire at the end of the calendar year. Section 4. That § 32-7B-8 be amended to read as follows: 32-7B-8. Each license may be issued for a multiple year period. The application for license and all applicable fees are due prior to the issuance of the initial license. The initial fee for a license shall be two hundred fifty dollars, and a renewal license shall be one hundred seventy- five dollars. All licenses shall be reviewed annually by the department. The department shall mail to the licensee at the last known address a renewal notice. The department shall establish by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26 the review date, if other than October first to December thirty-first, inclusive. If the licensee fails to return the renewal notice or to pay the applicable fees, the department shall cancel and revoke the license pursuant to the provisions of §§ 32-7B-16 and 32-7B-17. Section 5. That § 32-6C-5 be amended to read as follows: 32-6C-5. Upon making initial application for a dealer's license, the applicant shall pay a fee of one hundred fifty dollars to the department. Each license shall be valid from July first through the following June thirtieth, unless suspended or revoked prior to the expiration date. A renewal application shall be submitted to the department annually, along with a renewal fee of fifty one hundred twenty-five dollars, prior to the expiration of the old license. Any snowmobile dealer that was licensed by the department during the period of July 1, 1985, through the following June 30, 1986, shall be eligible to renew his license for a fee of fifty dollars during the period of July 1, 1987, through June 30, 1988. The renewal application shall contain the same information as is required in § 32-6C-3. Any application for renewal made after the expiration date shall be accompanied by a one hundred dollars an initial license fee. Any licensee who does not file his application and renewal fee with the department prior to the expiration date shall cease to engage in business as a dealer on the license expiration date. All money collected pursuant to this section shall be deposited in the state motor vehicle fund.
